title: AI/ET Partnership Series #4: AI tools and data
Expanding your market: Copyright protection
SOaR Joint Voices: Featuring three-step approach to filing a patent without an attorney and the USPTO Midwest Regional Office
description: Are you interested in filing a patent application without assistance from a registered patent attorney or agent? If so, join us Wednesday, September 27, from 1-4:30 p.m. ET, for a free virtual program provided by the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Stakeholder Offerings and Resources (SOaR) Joint Voices program. SOaR’s “Joint Voices” program highlights training opportunities and intellectual property (IP) educational programming resources that each USPTO regional office provides.

title: Expanding your market: Copyright protection
K-12 education office hours
PTAB Inventor Hour - Episode 22
description: Are you an inventor, entrepreneur, new practitioner, or just someone who wants to learn more about the USPTO and Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB)? Join us Thursday, September 28 at noon ET for the next PTAB Inventor Hour webinar, Episode 22. Learn more about PTAB's sibling tribunal, the Trademarks Trial and Appeal Board (TTAB), through a conversation between TTAB Judge Melanye Johnson and Attorney Advisor for Trademark Customer Outreach Mariessa Terrell. Then Sophia Johnson, Associate Director of Government Relations of the National Inventors Hall of Fame, will give us a virtual tour of the museum.

Strategies for protecting and enforcing intellectual property regarding China: What Green Bay and Wisconsin businesses need to know
description: Green Bay-area and Wisconsin enterprises doing business in or with China may find their valuable intellectual property (IP) is being infringed upon. Even businesses not operating in China may find counterfeit versions of their products for sale in China or the United States, or their trademarks registered in China without their knowledge. Join us for this free, one-day in-person program where experts from the U.S. Government, IP attorneys, and local business people will share insights on how U.S. rights holders can protect and enforce their IP in China and the United States.

Fireside Chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims
description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a fireside chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims. Judge Holte will discuss the jurisdiction and types of cases handled by the Court of Federal Claims, procedures used in those cases, and best practices when appearing before the court.
